intro: Koanophyllon jaegerianum, commonly known as the Jaeger's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its blue to purple flower heads appear in late summer and are composed of numerous tiny florets. Koanophyllon jaegerianum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
